text: Hey there! You’d need to use a completely custom HTML template for that so that it wouldn’t include the HubSpot-default responsiveness. May I ask why you want to maintain the desktop version? From a usability standpoint, I can’t imagine the reader’s experience would be very good trying to smash all of that content into a tiny mobile screen.
It's for our enewsletter so the formatting is pretty important for sponsors who buy placements.

I take back my previous recommendation - you may be able to stop the responsiveness by converting the template to a “Basic email template” as described here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/email-template-markup>
That worked!!!! Thank you so much :slightly_smiling_face:
